a complaint:
strength, power, or force:
to complain:
the flesh of cattle eaten as meat:
in: The spaghetti sauce is made with minced (US ground) beef.
People in England often have roast beef and Yorkshire pudding for lunch on Sundays.
He is a beef cattle farmer.
My main beef about the job is that I have to work on Saturdays.
He said that the newly published government report didn't have much beef in it.
Push harder! Put some beef into it!
He was beefing about having to do the shopping.
a roast beef sandwich
My beef is, how come I’m not making as much as you?
Stop beefing about having to work late – you’re not the only one.
Why on earth is it not beefed up now, without further delay?
Clearly, the whole treaty needs beefing up very fast indeed.
Another improvement will be what might be called beefing up the chairman, and he may have to be legally qualified.
I want the scheme to help farmers to improve hedgerows to be beefed up and made much more effective.

I agree with those who say that local access forums have to be beefed up.

definition: to have a grudge or start one with another person.

Marginalized Orientations, Gender identities, And Intersex. it’s meant to be an all inclusive umbrella term for asexuals, homosexuals, multisexuals, trans people, and intersex people. Alternative to LGBTQIAP+
Alternative to MOGII, easier to pronounce.
1. (n) - Meat from a cow2. (n) - A grudge or conflict3. (v) - To fart
to have beef with someone is wanting a fight with them. A person having something against someone else or wanting an argument or a fight
to start a fight, to get into argument with another person, or group of people

1. To fight or Scrap with another person.
2. Meat from a cow.
